question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. The convention being tested is the punctuation of a supplementary element within a sentence. The comma after "(13C)" pairs with the comma after "isotope" to separate the supplementary element "carbon-13 (13C)" from the rest of the sentence. This supplementary element defines the "rare carbon isotope," and the pair of commas indicates that this element could be removed without affecting the grammatical coherence of the sentence.
